alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Plains; Northwest Plateau; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 20 at 3:04PM MDT until April 20 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR MUCH OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT TODAY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING FOR THE CENTRAL MOUNTAINS, CENTRAL HIGHLANDS, AND NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Critical or near-critical conditions will subside around sunset as winds begin to decrease in speed. Winds may not fully subside in all areas, and some locations may remain gusty or at least breezy through the overnight. Humidity may only recover to 35 to 50 percent in many central areas tonight through Friday morning. Winds will strengthen again on Friday with gusts of 35 to 40 mph expected, especially along the central mountains, highlands and northeast highlands where very low humidity of 6 to 12 percent is expected again. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101), Northeast Plains (Zone 104), West Central Mountains (Zone 105), Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109), Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (Zone 121), Sangre de Cristo Mountains (Zone 122), East Central Plains (Zone 126) below snowpack through 8 pm MDT this evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to northwest 20 to 35 mph with gusts to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Around 6 to 10 percent at lower elevations. Around 15 to 22 percent above 8500 feet in the Sangre de Cristo mountains. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Plains; Northwest Plateau; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains
